fresno, ca (northeast) object being chased by 2 fighter jets at approximately 23:30 pm on june 26, 2012, i let my dogs out to do their nightly business. as usual, i went out with them to look at the stars. i was just getting ready to go back inside when i heard a louder than usual jet engine. i looked up to see two military fighters flying in a north to south direction at a high rate of speed. though i am not sure of the altitude, they appeared to be about one half inch in length. i am not sure how fast they were going. certainly not above mach i, but close, maybe. they were in a slight climb as they passed almost directly overhead. all of their navigational lights and strobes were on. just in front of the fighters (approximately one quarter of a mile), i saw a single, pale, greenish\white, spherical, or round light that was about one third of the size of the fighters. it was pulling away, slightly, from the jets. a few seconds later, the object executed a slight climbing right turn to the southwest, and accelerated, increasing the distance from the fighters as they turned to follow it. at that point, the object disappeared (winked out). the jets continued to the southwest until i could no longer see them. the whole sighting lasted no more than twenty seconds from the time i first saw the jets until the object winked out. it is unusual to see any aircraft flying north to south at the altitude i observed, because of the proximity to fresno air terminal, and the traffic patterns. though, at 11:30 pm, there is almost no air traffic at all. also, the air national guard is based at fat, and they tend to keep noise levels at a minimum over the city. the air guard flies f-16s, and lemore naval air station (nearby) flies fa-18s. hopefully, this will help determine the altitude they were flying. i am a retired information technology analyst, and a private pilot.
